intro: Diplectria biligulata, commonly known as the two-lobed sandwort, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a small, herbaceous annual that typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters at the ends of its stems. Its leaves are linear and often appear in pairs, giving the plant its scientific name. It is adapted to arid environments and is often found in coastal or inland sandy regions.
